myEngine

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • myEngine.World
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public abstract class World
extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
    A World is an extension of a Pane that holds Actors (which are custom ImageView objects). Since a World is a Pane it already keeps track of its children Nodes for you. If you want a list of Actors in the World, call getChildren() - assuming you have only added Actors and not other types of Nodes. A World contains one private attribute: private AnimationTimer timer; When a World is created, you should initialize a new AnimationTimer object using an anonymous inner class. Inside the handle() method, you should tell the World to act() and then go through the list of all Actors in the World and tell each of them to act()

    • Field Detail

      • timer

        private javafx.animation.AnimationTimer timer

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World()
        Creates a world. The world will initially be a size determined by its parent Node. When start() is called, the world will begin to call act on itself and on each of its Actor children every frame.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the timer that calls the act method on the world and on each Actor in the world each frame.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the timer that calls the act method.

      • add

        public void add(Actor actor)
        Adds the given actor to the world. Remember that since a World is a Pane, all you need to do is get the Children list of the Pane and add the Actor to it.
        Parameters:
        actor - the actor to add

      • remove

        public void remove(Actor actor)
        Removes the given actor from the world. The implementation is similar to add() but instead of adding to the existing child list, you are removing from it.
        Parameters:
        actor - The actor to remove.

      • getObjects

        public <A extends Actor> java.util.List<A> getObjects(java.lang.Class<A> cls)
        Returns a list of all the actors in the world of the given class. Implementation directions: The method header is given to you already so just copy it as is. What you need to do is to first make some kind of List (for example: ArrayList) of type A objects. Then iterate through the list of children in the world and for each child, if all of the following conditions are met, then add the child to the list and return the list after the loop is finished.

        - The child's Class type matches the method parameter's Class type
        Type Parameters:
        A - the type of actors
        Parameters:
        cls - The type of actor that will be in the list
        Returns:
        a list of all the actors in the world of the given class.

      • act

        public abstract void act(long now)
        This method is called every frame once start has been called.
        Parameters:
        now - the current time in nanoseconds.
